page.title: 12Leather Industry In Yeovil.
page.content: {Yeovil is famous for leather, especially{gloves.}It was mentioned in 1327 when John Glover and John Scynner were said to make the best gloves in the west of England. In 1724 Daniel Defoe wrote about Yeovil:{"A market {town of good resort:it's main {manufacture is the making of gloves." In the 18th century there was a thriving cottage indusry around Yeovil for the cutting and sewing of gloves. In 1834 300,000 dozen (the traditional unit of measure) gloves were made by an estimated 20,000 men,women and chidren. In 1927 an apprentice glover started work for 50p for a 46 h. week. He had no holiday apart from Bank Holiday. Today only 2 small firms make gloves by hand where before 1939 there were over 40.{Yeovil's tradition of {leather is carried on by Pittards, {leather specialists since 1826.
